intro: Myginda scoparia, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is perennial, with silver-gray foliage that helps it conserve water in harsh environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Myginda scoparia is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils and can withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
